title: Can I sue for harmful credit reporting?
question: Chrysler capital has reported a car that we settled in a bankruptcy as a repossession and our second car with them that we have paid for a year and a half is not reported as positive credit. We called them last week and they said they needed 48 hours, we called 72 hours later and they can't seem to find our information anywhere and asked us to call back. We are out of a vehicle and no one will accept us to finance us.
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Chapter 13 bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Chapter 13 bankruptcy reorganization plan,Lawsuits and disputes,Car loan,Representing yourself
answers:
Lawsuit is premature. You cannot sue for creditor accurately reporting information.
Best practice is to ask your attorney to contact creditor and credit bureaus to correct incorrect information on your credit report.
